channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Side Effects of Covid Vaccines
item.description: Thousands of Americans have filed vaccine-injury claims with the federal government.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Turkey Severs Trade With Israel, Citing Conditions in Gaza
item.description: The suspension will last until “uninterrupted and adequate” aid is allowed into the territory, Turkey said.

item.title: Carvana's father-son founding duo have made $11bn during 3,000% stock rebound
item.description: The one-day surge pushed the older Garcia’s fortune to $10.9 billion from a 2022 low of $3.1 billion, while his son’s net worth climbed to $3.8 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

item.title: Witness Who Extracted Secret Tape of Trump Will Return to the Stand
item.description: Douglas Daus, a forensic analyst in the Manhattan district attorney’s office, obtained the audio from the phones of Michael D. Cohen, Mr. Trump’s former fixer.

item.title: U.K. Conservatives Suffer Sharp Setbacks in Early Results of Local Elections
item.description: The scale of the losses suffered by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s party sent an ominous message about its chances in an upcoming general election.

item.title: Norway's $1.6tn oil fund CEO—who said Americans work harder than Europeans—has a countdown in his office to show how many days he has left on he job
item.description: "Now why do I have that? Is it because I don't like my job? No. I love my job."

item.title: U.K. Conservatives Suffer Sharp Setbacks in Early Results of Local Elections
item.description: The scale of the losses suffered by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s party sent an ominous message about its chances in an upcoming general election.

item.title: A Portrait Artist Fit for a King (but Not a President)
item.description: Jonathan Yeo, about to unveil a major new painting of King Charles III, also counts Hollywood royalty (Nicole Kidman) and prime ministers (Tony Blair) as past subjects. But George W. Bush eluded him.

item.title: 7-to-7 is the new 9-to-5: Research shows that workers’ days in the office are fewer but longer than pre-pandemic
item.description: Sorry, Dolly Parton working nine to five is no longer a way to make a living.

item.title: What to Watch Today in the April Jobs Report
item.description: Economists expect another strong month for job creation, even as other indicators of labor demand weaken.

item.title: Some NASA Satellites Will Soon Stop Sending Data Back to Earth
item.description: Three long-running satellites will soon be switched off, forcing scientists to figure out how to adjust their views of our changing planet.

item.title: Nippon Steel is putting off its $14.1bn takeover of U.S. Steel by 3 months
item.description: The new timing could push the closing beyond the election, but Nippon Steel denied the delay was related to that.

item.title: What Happened When the Skating Coaches Wanted a Union
item.description: A group of figure skating coaches at Chelsea Piers in Manhattan, many of whom earn less than $40,000 a year, sought to bargain their contracts collectively. Two were fired.

item.title: Weapons in U.S. Aid Bill Can’t Come Fast Enough for Ukraine
item.description: President Biden and Ukraine’s allies have invoked a sense of urgency over weapon deliveries. But there are logistical hurdles, and Ukraine has little time to lose.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds blasts ‘the thick buttress of bureaucracy' slowing Wrexham stadium expansion
item.description: Reynolds and co-owner Rob McElhenney have run into scrapes with regulators over their attempts to expand Wrexham's Racecourse stadium.
